summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from April 2013 concerning a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for the FBI file on Jeffrey Epstein (case 31E-MM-108062). It details the FBI's internal process to deny the request, citing an ongoing investigation and the need to articulate potential harm from release. It also reveals that the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida had been recused from the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of FBI investigation and FOIA requester
persons.context: The main subject of the FBI file (31E-MM-108062). He has made multiple FOIA requests for his FBI file since 2010 and appealed a denial in December 2012.

events.title: Epstein's FOIA Requests for FBI File
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made three Freedom of Information Act requests for his FBI file since 2010 and appealed the latest denial in December 2012 to the DOJ's Office of Information Policy.

events.title: Recusal of Southern District of Florida USAO
events.description: The Associate Deputy Attorney General approved the recusal of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from the Epstein investigation, assigning it to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Middle District of Florida. The investigation is noted as ongoing.

events.title: FBI Request for Harm Rationale
events.description: The DOJ's Office of Information Policy (OIP) requested the FBI articulate potential harm (e.g., discouraging witnesses, hampering leads, endangering informants) if the Epstein file were processed for FOIA release.

events.title: OIP Threatens to Overturn Exemption
events.description: An attorney for OIP informed the FBI she would recommend overturning the 'B7A' exemption (which allows withholding law enforcement records) for the Epstein file if she did not receive a 'harm rationale' that day.

events.title: FBI Requests Epstein Case File for FOIA Litigation
events.description: A Legal Administrative Specialist from the FBI's Records Management Division requested the physical Epstein case file to respond to FOIA litigation, noting the case agent had approved processing with division review.

locations: Tampa (likely referring to FBI Tampa Field Office or USAO Middle District of Florida)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was actively seeking his FBI file through FOIA requests and appeals as late as 2012-2013.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida was formally recused from the Epstein investigation by March 2013, with the case reassigned to the Middle District of Florida.
The FBI was actively working to deny Epstein's FOIA request by citing an ongoing investigation and the need to protect it from harm (e.g., discouraging witnesses).

Internal FBI correspondence shows coordination between field offices (Miami, Tampa), the Records Management Division, and the DOJ's Office of Information Policy regarding the release of Epstein's file.
The document references case number 31E-MM-108062 as the FBI's file on Jeffrey Epstein.
